Basic.description: The first loop on the hook to begin any crochet project.
Starting point for most crochet projects. Forms the foundation row.
Used for joining, moving across stitches, or finishing.
Foundation stitch, creates tight fabric. Essential for amigurumi.
Medium height stitch between single and double crochet.
Taller stitch for height and drape. Very versatile.
Used for tall rows and lacy, open fabric.
Adds stitches to widen a row or round.
Combines stitches together to reduce width.
Combines two single crochet stitches into one.
Adjustable loop technique for starting projects in the round.
Used at the start of a new row to bring hook to proper height.
Used to join the end of a round to the beginning.
Secures the final stitch and cuts the yarn.
Very tall stitch with 2 yarn overs before inserting hook
Extremely tall stitch with 3 yarn overs
A loop of yarn on the hook

Shaping.description: Standard decrease technique worked across two stitches.
Wetting and shaping finished pieces to final dimensions.
Intentionally omit working into a stitch or space.

Other.description: A neater, less noticeable single crochet decrease.
Two stitches worked in the same space, forming a V-shape.
Multiple stitches worked into one space to create a fan shape.
A traditional square motif made of clusters and chains.
Inserted into a row below the current one to elongate the effect.
A slightly taller and looser double crochet stitch.
Tiny loops often used to finish borders or create texture.
Large openwork knot made from elongated chains, also called Lover's Knot.
Resembles knitted fabric; pulled through vertical bars.
Medium weight yarn, most common for afghans and sweaters.
Light weight yarn, stands for Double Knitting.
Bulky yarn for quick projects and warm garments.
Number of stitches and rows per inch. Critical for proper sizing.
Indicates a sequence of stitches to be repeated.
Gap between stitches where new stitches are worked.
Working two or more stitches together as one.
Loops drawn up on large needle, then secured with single crochet.
Strips made on a hairpin loom and crocheted together.

Foundation.description: Combines foundation chain and first row in one step.
Combines foundation chain and first row of hdc in one step.

Texture.description: Stitch worked only into the back loop for texture effects.
Stitch worked only into the front loop for ribbing effects.
Creates raised vertical lines, perfect for ribbing effects.
Works with FPDC to create dimensional ribbing and cables.
A tall stitch worked around the post from the front.
A tall stitch worked around the post from the back.
Creates a puffed, round shape that stands out from the fabric.
Multiple incomplete stitches worked together, then closed.
Creates a soft, puffy texture; different from popcorn.
Multiple stitches worked into same base, creating dense texture.
Creates a crossed or twisted visual effect.
Alternating single crochet and chain stitches for texture.
Creates a bumpy texture similar to purl in knitting.

Technique.description: Wrap yarn around hook - fundamental movement in crochet
Place stitch marker in stitch or between stitches
Move marker from one needle to the other

Pattern.description: Horizontal line of stitches worked back and forth
The front/public side of the work
The back/private side of the work

Finishing.description: Hide yarn tails by weaving through stitches
Secure stitches at end of piece

Construction.description: Join pieces together with needle and yarn

tunisian.description: Worked into front and back vertical bars

amigurumi.description: Technique for smooth color changes in rounds
Working around chain for oval base

modern.description: Planned color placement with variegated yarn
Working on top of base fabric

construction.description: Join with slip stitch or sc

yarn.description: Super fine weight yarn, often used for socks
Fine weight yarn between fingering and DK
Extra thick yarn for fast projects
Ultra fine yarn for delicate lace
Looped bundle of yarn needing winding

vintage.description: Vintage fan pattern resembling peacock tail

tool.description: Hook with aligned head and shaft
Marker to track rounds or stitches

specialty.description: Long spike stitches forming V shapes

garment.description: Decreases and increases for fitted waist

slang.description: Undo stitches one at a time (knit backwards)
Alternative to HOTH - newly completed crochet project
Playful term for someone who crochets (uses a hook)
Humorous term for compulsive need to crochet
Taking your crochet project out in public spaces
Crochet projects stored in grocery bags
Project so frustrating you gave up completely
Your crochet motivation and creative energy

regional.description: Complex cable patterns from Celtic tradition
Delicate flower motifs from Japanese patterns
Hexagonal motif popular in African crafts
Provisional cast on from Turkish tradition

mathematical.description: Using Fibonacci numbers for stripe sequences
Square worked from corner to corner

embellishment.description: Slip stitch worked on fabric surface
Cut yarn strands attached to edge

hybrid.description: Using large needle with crochet hook
Lace strips made on hairpin loom

troubleshooting.description: Hoping to finish before yarn runs out

technique.description: Creates interlocking diamond pattern using Tunisian crochet base
Using wire instead of yarn for sculptural pieces
Working slip stitch on top of finished fabric

stitch.description: Double crochets linked through horizontal bars for denser fabric
Creates loops on surface for fur or fringe effect
stitch.best_for: Fur texture, Rugs, Hair on amigurumi

foundation.description: Creates foundation chain and first row of DC simultaneously
Starting projects without traditional chain foundation
